title: Why do I have so many 820-3536 boards that boot but have no video output??
message: That's it. Just wondering if anyone else has had this experience and might have some insight. They're starting to pile up. This is the latest one: [URL="https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/12961-820-3536-no-video-output"]820-3536 No video output.[/URL]

title: Why do I have so many 820-3536 boards that boot but have no video output??
message: Are you buying them all from the same source? Dear god I hope you aren't buying boards on eBay. If you are, then there's your answer. Probably all have bad CPUs.

title: Why do I have so many 820-3536 boards that boot but have no video output??
Why do I have so many 820-3536 boards that boot but have no video output??
message: I've noticed that the 3476/3536 boards (along with the 00164/165 boards) seem to be more "fragile" when it comes to liquid...they seem to die with even a moderate amount of liquid damage in the wrong spot. Definitely not as robust as the non-retina boards. I don't know what it is about the design or characteristics of the CPUs, but they seem to have a lot higher rate of CPU failure than previous models.

title: Why do I have so many 820-3536 boards that boot but have no video output??
message: Interesting. Thanks for the info, good to know.

title: Why do I have so many 820-3536 boards that boot but have no video output??
message: What are you seeing that confirms it's a CPU failure versus something else?
